attributes.action: This government forget RURAL areas in transport policy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Whilst central government continue to add ridiculous taxes to four wheel drive vehicles referring to them as "gas guzzlers" they forget about us in rural areas like the South West of England where farmers and the like depend on these type of vehicles for access in wintry weather conditions.

The new proposed £400 a year road fund licence for these vehicles is both unfair and poorly thought out and we ask that the government abandon this with immediate effect.

This together with many villages having no regular bus services and being many miles form train stations leads me to believe that this government FORGET us in the the more rural areas of the UK

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
